page.title: 10Gamekeeping at Wath
page.content: The gamekeeper at Wath covers an area of 1350 acres. He is responsible for the game shooting on this land, which is mainly moorland. Most of the shooting is for grouse and for this he has built another two butts this year. These are square in shape, built of stone and about four feet high. The walls are then finished off by putting peat on the top edge of the stones. When a group of people are out grouse shooting, two men use a butt and from these they shoot the grouse as they rise from the ground. Last night local gamekeepers were out fox hunting. They went out with guns and dogs for two and a half hours, but only one fox was caught. They hunt these animals because they eat grouse, particularly the young. This year, some grouse have been found dead because of the cold spring.
